Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2009 07:23PM lamomimax1 wrote: I also had a birad 4 US and MRI.  I went crazy too.  When I went in for my stereotactic they took my blood pressure and it was 169/114 with a pulse of 110.  My blood pressure is usually 116/80!!  Talk about stressed. However, the whole time I tried to remember the 80% stat.  Turns out that the results were b9.  Keep positive, take care of yourself, and try to keep yourself busy - it helps.  Hugs to you!
Posts.Title: BIRADS 4 mommyalways mommyalways

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2009 09:22PM lamomimax1 wrote: Great points!!!   As Jeanne stated earlier...feeling in control is key to surviving the weeks between finding a lump and the results.  I had my biopsy done by a radiologist at a breast center who was able to get me in 2+ weeks earlier than the 2 breast surgeons (recommended by my dr) I called.  This radiologist also returned my call immediately two days after the biopsy to confirm that my results were benign.  She also faxed me the report right away I had called my regular dr. 3 times for results and was told they didn't have them or the dr. was out.  After dealing with my dr. office I decided to call the radiologist's office....the office was very helpful.  Turns out my dr. didn't call on Friday or Monday but let me hang over the 4th of July weekend before he called on Tuesday morning.  Almost 6 days after the results had been faxed to him.  The point of this rambling story is keep calling and look for alternatives.  Also, I have said it before and I will say it again.  Request and keep your reports and path results.  My original report called for a biopsy - but my dr. didn't read past "probable benign findings but based on family history a biopsy is recommended".  I didn't see this until over 8 months later when I requested a copy of my report.  Dr's. are only human and they can make mistakes and errors so it is better to be an advocate for your health and read everything yourself too.
Posts.Title: Found Small Lump -Diagnostic Mamo and Ultrasound are Clear jeannemh lamomimax1

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2009 11:03AM lamomimax1 wrote: I originallly had an appt. with a surgeon - 3 weeks out but I couldn't wait.  I was able to get an appt. with my radiologist (a women's breast diagnostic center) the earliest so I went with it.  Then my Dr.'s office scheduled a follow up with the surgeon.  However, I had to push my dr. office to call and set up an appt. for me.  The receptionist at the surgeon's office told me that my dr. should make the appt. or else I would not be seen quickly.  So I had to push them. I would suggest having your dr.s office make the appt. too.  They can usually push the date up and make your wait more bearable.   I was 100% satisfied having the diagnostic radiologist perform my biopsy (stereotactic) and that may be an option for you if the wait time is really long for the surgeon.  I just wanted to know and their office could get me in much quicker. Like others have written, ask for/demand as many tests as you need until you are satisfied.  Alot of times they won't be offered  -  you have to ask.  Prayers and hugs.
Posts.Title: Found Small Lump -Diagnostic Mamo and Ultrasound are Clear jeannemh lamomimax1

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2009 09:53PM lamomimax1 wrote: I know what a scary time this is for you.  Please try to relax and take care of yourself during this stressful time.  I just went through something similar but I had some other scary symptoms that have since cleared up and it was probably the most stressful time in my life.  I insisted on a MRI and it showed something - based on my family history I requested a biopsy of the lump.  I did all this knowing that 80% of lumps are benign and trying to stay positive that I was in that 80%. It was.  I did this for piece of mind.  The morning of my biopsy I was the most nervous I have ever been but it was not as scary as I had thought.  If it would make you feel better, I would request a biopsy of the lump.  It is a little stressful but for me it helped clear up any questions and what if's I had.  As far as questions, make sure to write them all down before you go and maybe bring someone with you to the appt.  to help you.  Also, based on experience I would request copies of all of your mammo, ultrasound reports.  I felt much more in control of my experience when I had the copies on hand and I could ask questions based on these reports.  Again, please take care of yourself.  Prayers and hugs!
Posts.Title: Found Small Lump -Diagnostic Mamo and Ultrasound are Clear jeannemh lamomimax1
